TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The "Notice My Bug Report, Senpai" Edition

Articles.Content:
Darn, we're studying this like it's the Kennedy assassination or something. Maybe all these are actually nothing, just tricks of the light and such?

Could be that too but that approach isn't nearly as fun .

My guess is something dull like bank loans.
Except apparently it's also fun to do again and again..

Maybe there's a foreclosure "game over" scene, where the VAB is repossessed and a sole Bill Bixby-esque kerbal wanders into the distance, up a long road, with "The Lonely Man" theme playing in the background.

Almost certainly the case.

Tugs at my heart strings just thinking about it.

- "the biggest arts asset"

- Harvester had fun doing it over and over again

- good players will probably never see it

New explosion effects?

Interactive demo
I could be mistaken, but I believe the big art asset thing was for the unannounced 0.26 feature.

I could be mistaken, but I believe the big art asset thing was for the unannounced 0.26 feature.

That was my understanding. So we're left with something that:

-hasn't been done before by a mod

-good players might never see

-HarvesteR was having fun with over and over

I'm guessing something explodey. Maybe a new way for spacecraft to spontaneously disassemble. Maybe not deformable terrain, but blast marks where explosions have happened?

Or maybe we will be able to put pieces back together after they've fallen apart (not sure if there's a mod for that).

Or maybe we will be able to put pieces back together after they've fallen apart (not sure if there's a mod for that).

Possible. Fits the clues, has been long-requested, and SQUAD have talked about wanting to include Apollo 13-like in-flight repairs.

Possible. Fits the clues, has been long-requested, and SQUAD have talked about wanting to include Apollo 13-like in-flight repairs.

I specifically remember HarvesteR talking about it a LONG time ago. Not fixing random breakage, but if you treat something harshly and it falls off or is damaged, you should be able to repair it. Repairing wheels was supposed to be just the beginning.
Don't forget that it's something that they didn't want to tell us about and let us discover with hilarity. Not sure reassembling broken pieces would be funny.

I would give this guess for that secret thingy:

Ejection seats with parachutes for the ejected Kerbal.

This would perfectly fit into SQUADS sense of humor.

Ejection seats with parachutes for the ejected Kerbal.

I will now be disappointed if it's anything other than this.

Edit: Parade rained on by Alshain.

Edited September 12, 2014 by Red Iron Crown

I would give this guess for that secret thingy:

Ejection seats with parachutes for the ejected Kerbal.

This would perfectly fit into SQUADS sense of humor.

Been modded. Vanguard Technologies.

If there is a posting somewhere of a new airplane cockpit (top-down) we might be able to see the cutaway line for the canopy, if they went as far as ejector seats.

Commence the browsing!

(Of no real purpose...)

EDIT:

Been modded. Vanguard Technologies.

Drat.

Been modded. Vanguard Technologies.

[insert curse of your choice]

Edit: Parade rained on by Alshain.

EDIT:

Drat.

[insert curse of your choice]

Sorry, I thought you would enjoy knowing you could have it today instead of waiting to 0.25

It really is a good mod, and with a MM patch you can add it to all cockpits without a part.

Sorry, I thought you would enjoy knowing you could have it today instead of waiting to 0.25

Now I am unsure if I should be thankful or grumpy. May one be of the alignment "thankful grumpy"?

Now I am unsure if I should be thankful or grumpy. May one be of the alignment "thankful grumpy"?

Grudgingly grateful here, too.

From the SquadCast thread,

re-reading the stuff about the log re-vamp and then re-reading these quips:
Quotes on the unknown thing

- "You can play 1000 hours and never run into this if your good"

- "Harvestr was having fun doing this over and over again"

- "This is something no mod has ever done. Flat out. We are super happy about it."

- "It's cool. Good players might not run into it, they might want to for fun.

I'm almost certain Squad's talking about a time lapse-esque post-flight forward/rewind/pause/slo-mo flight log video recording. I may be wrong, but I don't recall any mods that have done this specifically so far, and it fits very well into all the quips and the flight log overhaul they mentioned.

edit: Which, ultimately, it's just another marketing vehicle I guess because if the camera can be re-positioned in these flight logs, it'll make for more interesting YouTubes, but experienced players (read: players who don't need to check failure logs) don't benefit much from the feature.

From the SquadCast thread,

If it was recording/playback feature, I'm pretty sure experienced players would run into it rather soon. It's not like they don't use flight log.

Assuming all these clues are true, it's about situations which good players generally avoid - such as Kerbal deaths, destructive lithobraking, ship collisions, near misses at high speed, running out of fuel, running out of electricity.

My personal favorite is still semitransparent Kerbal spirit appearing in space where you just killed a Kerbal, and flying away towards Kerbal Heaven (or KSC). It fits all criteria but somehow I doubt I can be right about it.

"Procedurally Generated Cutscenes".

I would love to see that.

Oy. If they're anything like the procedurally generated contract text...

Oy. If they're anything like the procedurally generated contract text...

so basically, and that's where you come in.
Squadcast tonight. Maybe we can torture request for information about the mystery runway structure and whether or not KSC is getting a pool.

Squadcast tonight. Maybe we can torture request for information about ... whether or not KSC is getting a pool.

I think this may be the safest bet on the pool:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/90612-0-25-Discussion-thread?p=1412593&viewfull=1#post1412593

Looking at the picture the new runway structure reminds me of an airport fire station, the positioning at the runway, tower to hang hoses to dry. Maybe a crash landing has a few kerbals jumping into emergency vehicles to put out the flames. Not done in any mods, good players may never see.

Looking at the picture the new runway structure reminds me of an airport fire station, the positioning at the runway, tower to hang hoses to dry. Maybe a crash landing has a few kerbals jumping into emergency vehicles to put out the flames. Not done in any mods, good players may never see.

That's a great suggestion, and supported by the Rowsdower Image, too.

Is somebody up for summarizing the Squadcast for those of us who'll miss it?

That's a great suggestion, and supported by the Rowsdower Image, too.

Is somebody up for summarizing the Squadcast for those of us who'll miss it?

I would but I'm really bad at note taking. Better if someone else does.
